metadata.title: CVE-2019-0211 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - high
metadata.description:
In Apache HTTP Server 2.4 releases 2.4.17 to 2.4.38, with MPM event, workeror prefork, code executing in less-privileged child processes or threads(including scripts executed by an in-process scripting interpreter) couldexecute arbitrary code with the privileges of the parent process (usuallyroot) by manipulating the scoreboard. Non-Unix systems are not affected.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-0211` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.21
apache2-bin - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.21
apache2-data - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.21
apache2-mpm-event - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.21
apache2-mpm-itk - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.21
apache2-mpm-prefork - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.21
apache2-mpm-worker - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.21
apache2-suexec - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.21
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.21
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.21
apache2-utils - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.21
apache2.2-bin - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.21
libapache2-mod-macro - 1:2.4.7-1ubuntu4.21
libapache2-mod-proxy-html - 1:2.4.7-1ubuntu4.21
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apache2 package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.4.7-1ubuntu4.21').
